title: Make some stuff from test/common.py part of lib?
body_html:
Some code in test/common.py is very useful for writing test for my own high-level pytorch code, especially TestCase. But I cannot use it as a library user. It would be nice to have proper testing support as part of PyTorch, it would probably amount to moving some of these into torch/testing/...

If it has any significance, tensorflow has proper testing support as part of the library here.
body_text:
Some code in test/common.py is very useful for writing test for my own high-level pytorch code, especially TestCase. But I cannot use it as a library user. It would be nice to have proper testing support as part of PyTorch, it would probably amount to moving some of these into torch/testing/...
If it has any significance, tensorflow has proper testing support as part of the library here.
body:
Some code in [test/common.py](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/test/common.py) is very useful for writing test for my own high-level pytorch code, especially `TestCase`. But I cannot use it as a library user. It would be nice to have proper testing support as part of PyTorch, it would probably amount to moving some of these into [torch/testing/..](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/tree/master/torch/testing).

If it has any significance, tensorflow has proper testing support as part of the library [here](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_guides/python/test).
